summary: Removes the helmet requirement for armor perks.  So take off your hat and come on in.
descriptionHtml:
This file will remove the helmet requirement for armor perks.  Now you can remove your helmet or put on unarmored hats without fear of losing your perk benefits.  If you\'ve been wanting to go dungeon delving in a chef\'s hat, now\'s your chance.  One caveat though, you can\'t mix armor types.  So if you are wearing Heavy Armor and put on a Light helmet, all the perks below will shut off except Matching Set.  I\'m still looking for a way to resolve this.  The perks affected are:

Heavy Armor
-  Cushioned
-  Well Fitted
-  Matching Set
-  Reflect Blows

Light Armor
-  Custom Fit
-  Matching Set
-  Wind Walker
-  Deft Movement

If you are using my other mod, No Perk Prerequisites -  http://skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=1943, I have included a compatibility patch as an optional file.  Use this esp in place of BOTH No Helmets Required and No Perk Prerequisites.  You should only have one file checked.

*****************
Special thanks to feanbeast for his Ebony Armor Matching Set Fix. Matching Set does not work for Ebony Armor in Vanilla Skyrim. feanbeast\'s mod corrects this. The standalone bug fix can be found at http://skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=2507. This fix is now incorporated into all files
*****************

To install, extract to your Data folder, and check the esp in Data Files in the game launcher. If Data Files is grayed out, add

bEnableFileSelection=1

to C:\\Users\\*Your User Name*\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim\\SkyrimPrefs.ini.

Enjoy!

------------------
Change Log
------------------
v.1.2
- Added feanbeast\'s Ebony Armor Matching Set Fix to all files (http://skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=2507). This corrects a bug in Vanilla Skyrim where Matching Set did not function for Ebony Armor.

v1.1
Corrected an issue where Matching Set was not working without a helmet for several armor sets.
